content: Another update: quote: Iran to Send 2 Warships to Somalia Coast Waters against Pirates TEHRAN (FNA)- Iran's Ambassador to the United Nations in a letter to Secretary General Ban Ki-moon informed him of Tehran's will to send 2 warships to Somalia's coastal waters and Gulf of Aden to confront pirates and safeguard Iranian commercial and oil cargo ships. Mohammad Khaza'ie in the letter refers to the international efforts aimed at combating piracy in Gulf of Aden and the coastal waters of Somalia. According to the Islamic republic news agency, Khaza'ie in his letter added that the Iranian Navy ships would take position at operation region within the next two days and remain there for a period of at least five months. The Iranian warships would in addition to safeguarding the Iranians ships and ships that are in a way related to Iran assist any other foreign ship... (...) ++http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=8802240337
quote: Iran to Send 2 Warships to Somalia Coast Waters against Pirates TEHRAN (FNA)- Iran's Ambassador to the United Nations in a letter to Secretary General Ban Ki-moon informed him of Tehran's will to send 2 warships to Somalia's coastal waters and Gulf of Aden to confront pirates and safeguard Iranian commercial and oil cargo ships. Mohammad Khaza'ie in the letter refers to the international efforts aimed at combating piracy in Gulf of Aden and the coastal waters of Somalia. According to the Islamic republic news agency, Khaza'ie in his letter added that the Iranian Navy ships would take position at operation region within the next two days and remain there for a period of at least five months. The Iranian warships would in addition to safeguarding the Iranians ships and ships that are in a way related to Iran assist any other foreign ship... (...) ++http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=8802240337

content: If they are Islamic terrorists Grachus, they probably ain't Shi'a ones so the Iranians don't care. It might be an interesting way for other navies to get a look at how the Iranians work outside of the relative safety of the Persian Gulf when they can run to home port in a few hours. 'Tis a shame HMS Cornwall isn't the RN ship on that station, this might have been an opportunity for some of her company to get their Ipods back.

content: Wonder what will be the source of replenishment for these vessels?... Might be a good chance to observe the Iranian navy in action and it might even be a good idea, through the Iranian sailors, to let Iran know that most of the world, including the U.S. doesn't really wish them ill, though you wouldn't know it from the actions of most of the world, including the U.S.... Maybe this might, in a way, get everyone to let some of the paranoia go... Still, there is the problem of the Iranians and dear ole "Imanutjob" and their attempt at achieving a nuclear weapon... Perhaps if ole "Imanutjob" was gone, the world might breath a bit easier, at least Israel would... IMHO... Respectfully, SUNLINER81

content: Wow. So a whole squadron of SIX Iranian WARSHIPS is going there as well? quote: IRAN: SIX WARSHIPS DISPATCHED TO THE GULF OF ADEN AGI) - Teheran, 25 May - Iran has dispatched six warships to the Gulf of Aden. The news was released by press agency ISNA, reporting a declaration by Admiral Habibollah Sayyari. The ships' presence, the Admiral said, is a signal to anyone who would want to militarily face the Ayatollah regime. On May 14, the Admiral had announced the dispatch of two warships to the Gulf of Aden to protect Iranian oil tankers from pirate attacks... ++http://www.agi.it/world/n...2009052...e_gulf_of_aden
quote: IRAN: SIX WARSHIPS DISPATCHED TO THE GULF OF ADEN AGI) - Teheran, 25 May - Iran has dispatched six warships to the Gulf of Aden.
